head.title: A Poetic Look At Glen Cove Ferries

hedline.hl1: A Poetic Look At Glen Cove Ferries

abstract.p: Letter from Aggie Goldsmith offers sarcastic poem about gambling ferries being brought to Hempstead Harbor in Glen Cove (Nov 21 article) (S)

block.p: I'd like to thank Mayor Tom Suozzi of Glen Cove for his most generous holiday gifts. He has given more to our community than anyone I can remember. I'd like to thank Mayor Tom Suozzi of Glen Cove for his most generous holiday gifts. He has given more to our community than anyone I can remember. And the gambling ferries he is bringing to Hempstead Harbor [''Glen Cove Still Suitor for Foxwoods Ferry,'' Nov. 21] are gifts that will keep on giving.
To their engines we'll listen. How their fuel slicks will glisten!
The ferry parking lot lights will shine so bright, folks won't know if it's day or night.
Our small streets and roads, the added cars and buses will overload.
No more boating or canoeing or swimming, thanks to the unsafe conditions his bringing.
Nearby towns and villages are so grateful that in his decisions he is so faithful.
There will be only four boats, he was heard to say. Now we know there will be eight a day.
This deal he pushed through -- he really did scurry, saying to all, ''Don't worry.'' We'd like to know, what was his hurry?
Was his plan to not give people time to think, so his project wouldn't sink?
On Jan. 15, the ferries will start. People living in surrounding towns and villages are saying, in this we want no part.
He might also take note, we are citizens, and we vote.
